intro: Wikstroemia basicordata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are covered in fine, white hairs. Wikstroemia basicordata is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
